title: Calories in Chicken Salad
meta_description: Discover calories in chicken salad per serving, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Homemade with cooked chicken breast, mayonnaise, celery, onion; standard recipe without nuts, fruits, or added dressings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ingredient brands, portion sizes, and preparation; check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A 200 g serving of chicken salad contains about 430 kcal and 30 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

tweaks.label: Add 50 g grapes per 200 g serving
Substitute Greek yogurt for half the mayo

faqs.q: How many calories in a serving of chicken salad?
faqs.a: About 430 kcal in a 200 g serving of standard chicken salad.

faqs.q: What's the protein in chicken salad?
faqs.a: Around 30 g protein per 200 g serving, mostly from the chicken.

faqs.q: Does chicken salad have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 30 g fat per 200 g, primarily from mayonnaise; opt for low-fat versions to reduce.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in chicken salad?
faqs.a: Use Greek yogurt or light mayo, add more veggies like celery, and reduce mayo quantity.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in chicken salad?
faqs.a: Minimal, about 6 g carbs per 200 g, from onions and celery; fruits can increase this.
